Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: @eric-wieser What would you like to happen with this?

> @eric-wieser What would you like to happen with this?

I don't remember the motivation super clearly any more, but I'd still be happy to have it merged. Sorry for not applying your suggestions sooner!
I guess your contention is that `unitarySubgroup` should not have a `star` operation, and that the user should instead coerce into the group?
I guess your contention is that `unitarySubgroup` should not have a `star` operation, and that the user should instead coerce into the group?

for consistency
```suggestion
theorem mem_unitarySubgroup_iff {g : G} : g ∈ unitarySubgroup G ↔ g ∈ unitary G :=
```

I think the only case where one considers unitary elements in a group is in the groups of units of a monoid (I'd be interested to see another example though!), so we should mention it as the use case here.
```suggestion
/-- `unitary` as a `Subgroup` of a group.

Note the group structure on this type is not defeq to the one on `unitary`.
This situation naturally arises when considering the unitary elements as a 
subgroup of the group of units of a star monoid. -/
```

> I'd be interested to see another example though

Do module isomorphisms have a star operator? Another example I can think of are things which are morally units of a monoid, but happen to not actually be written with `Units`.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Star/Unitary): add unitarySubgroup
